intro: Hypericum jahnii, commonly known as the Jahn's St. John's wort, is a species of flowering plant in the family Clusiaceae. It is native to parts of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Guatemala. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and woody stems, which are typical features of the Hypericum genus. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
